term.title: Terms of use
term.text:
Welcome to Playly (the “App”), a Telegram-based companion application for Roblox® players. These Terms of Service ("Terms") form a legally binding agreement between you (“you”, “your” or “User”) and the entity operating Playly (“we”, “our”, or “us”). By accessing or using the App you acknowledge that you have read, understood and agree to be bound by these Terms, our Privacy Policy, and any additional policies referenced herein (collectively, the “Agreement”).
If you do not agree to any part of the Agreement you must discontinue use of the App immediately.

1. Definitions
Term
Meaning
“Coins”
An in‑app, non‑transferable, non‑redeemable virtual reward point issued exclusively by Playly and having no monetary value.
“Case” / “Cases”
A feature within the App that allows Users to spend Coins to receive random virtual items related to Roblox games (initially Adopt Me!).
“Robux Purchas”
A transaction whereby a User pays real money to have Roblox‑brand virtual currency (Robux) deposited directly to the User’s Roblox account.
“Virtual Item(s)”
Digital game items obtained from opening Cases, which may be (i) exported to a compatible Roblox account or (ii) sold back to Playly for additional Coins.
“Service”
All functionality provided by the App, including but not limited to referral programmes, daily Coin taps, Cases, Robux Purchases, social‑media integrations and customer support.


2. Eligibility & Account Registration
Age. You must be at least 13 years old (or the minimum digital‑consent age in your jurisdiction) to use the App. If you are under the age of majority, you represent that your parent or legal guardian has reviewed and accepted these Terms on your behalf.
Telegram Account. The App is delivered via Telegram. You must maintain an active Telegram account, remain in good standing with Telegram, and comply with its terms of service.
Roblox Account. Certain Services (e.g., exporting Virtual Items or receiving Robux) require a valid Roblox account. You are solely responsible for compliance with Roblox’s terms of use.
Accurate Information. You agree to provide true, complete and current information and to update it promptly when it changes.

3. Description of Services
3.1 Coins
Earned daily by tapping a Coin icon (up to 100 Coins per day), through referral bonuses, or by other promotional actions made available by Playly.
Cannot be purchased, withdrawn, exchanged for Robux, or converted into cash or any other thing of value.
3.2 Referral Programme
For each new User who joins via your unique link and completes the onboarding process, you receive 500 Coins.
Playly reserves the right to disqualify referrals generated by bots, fake accounts, or other abusive behaviour.
3.3 Cases & Virtual Items
Opening a Case consumes the listed amount of Coins and delivers one random Virtual Item.
Virtual Items do not confer real‑world ownership rights and have no monetary value.
Items may be (a) exported to your Roblox account (subject to technical availability) or (b) sold back to Playly in exchange for a specified amount of Coins.
3.4 Robux Purchases
Real‑money Robux Purchases are processed by approved third‑party payment providers. Prices and availability are displayed at the point of sale.
Purchased Robux are credited directly to your linked Roblox account; you will not receive Coins for these transactions.
All sales are final unless otherwise required by applicable law.
3.5 Social‑Media Actions
You may receive Coins for following Playly’s official social‑media accounts. 

4. License & Acceptable Use
Playly grants you a personal, revocable, non‑exclusive, non‑transferable, limited licence to use the App in accordance with the Agreement.
You agree not to:
violate any applicable law or Roblox/Telegram policy;
attempt to decompile, reverse engineer, or otherwise derive source code from the App;
use automation (scripts, bots) to farm Coins, referrals, or Virtual Items;
exploit bugs or undocumented features;
post or transmit any content that is illegal, harassing, defamatory, obscene or otherwise objectionable;
impersonate others or misrepresent your affiliation with any person.
We may suspend or terminate your access and confiscate Coins or Virtual Items gained in breach of these Terms.

5. Payments, Taxes & Chargebacks
Payment Processing. All Robux Purchases are handled by third‑party payment processors. Playly does not store your full payment‑card information.
Taxes. You are responsible for any applicable taxes, duties or fees arising from your transactions.
Chargebacks. If Playly receives a chargeback or payment dispute we may suspend your account, reverse the Robux delivery, and/or deduct Coins or Virtual Items of equivalent value.

6. Ownership & Intellectual Property
Playly and its licensors retain all intellectual‑property rights in the App, including trademarks, logos, graphics and software.
Roblox® and Robux® are trademarks of Roblox Corporation. Playly is not affiliated with, endorsed, sponsored, or specifically approved by Roblox Corporation.
You may not use our trademarks without prior written permission.

7. User Content
Responsibility. You are solely responsible for content you submit (e.g., profile images, usernames, chat messages).
Licence to Playly. By submitting content you grant Playly a worldwide, royalty‑free, sublicensable licence to use, reproduce, modify and display such content for the purpose of operating and improving the Services.

8. Privacy
Our collection and processing of personal data is governed by the Playly Privacy Policy, which forms part of this Agreement. Please review it carefully.

9. Disclaimers
No Gambling. Coins cannot be purchased with real money and have no cash value; Cases therefore do not constitute gambling under applicable law.
Service “AS IS”. The App and Services are provided “AS IS” and “AS AVAILABLE” without warranties of any kind, express or implied.
Platform Risk. Exporting Virtual Items to Roblox relies on third‑party APIs. We do not guarantee continuous compatibility.

10. Limitation of Liability
To the maximum extent permitted by law, Playly shall not be liable for indirect, incidental, special, consequential or punitive damages, or for any loss of profits, revenues, data or goodwill arising out of or related to the Agreement or your use of the App.

11. Indemnity
You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Playly, its affiliates, directors, employees and agents from any claims, damages, liabilities and expenses (including legal fees) arising from your breach of the Agreement or misuse of the Services.

12. Termination
Playly may suspend or terminate your access at any time with or without notice if we believe you have violated these Terms or pose a risk to other users or to Playly. Upon termination all licences granted to you shall immediately cease and any unused Coins or Virtual Items will be forfeited.

13. Changes to the Services or Terms
We may modify these Terms at any time, without prior notice. It is your responsibility to review the Terms regularly for any updates. Continued use after the effective date constitutes acceptance of the revised Terms.

14. Governing Law & Dispute Resolution

These Terms shall be governed by and construed exclusively in accordance with the laws of the Republic of Vanuatu, without regard to its conflict-of-law rules.
Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to these Terms (including their existence, validity, interpretation, performance, breach, or termination) shall be finally settled by binding arbitration administered by the Vanuatu International Arbitration Centre (VIAC) in accordance with the VIAC Rules in force on the date the Notice of Arbitration is submitted.
Seat (place) of arbitration: Port Vila, Vanuatu.
Language of arbitration: English.
Number of arbitrators: One, appointed by VIAC.
Confidentiality: The existence of the arbitration, all submissions, correspondence, evidence, and any award shall be strictly confidential.
No class or representative proceedings: Each party waives any right to participate in a class, consolidated, collective, or representative action or arbitration.
Judgment on the arbitral award may be entered and enforced in any court of competent jurisdiction. Each party irrevocably waives any objection to venue, personal jurisdiction, or inconvenient forum with respect to the arbitration proceedings or the enforcement of any award.


15. Severability
If any provision of these Terms is held invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect.

16. Entire Agreement
The Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between you and Playly regarding the App and supersedes all prior understandings.

policy.title: AML KYC
policy.text:
PLEASE READ THIS USER AGREEMENT CAREFULLY BEFORE USING PLAYLY. BY ACCESSING OR USING THE PLAYLY TELEGRAM APPLICATION OR ANY OF ITS RELATED SERVICES (COLLECTIVELY, THE “SERVICES”), YOU (“USER”, “YOU”, “YOUR”) CONFIRM THAT YOU HAVE READ, UNDERSTOOD AND AGREE TO BE BOUND BY THIS USER AGREEMENT (THE “AGREEMENT”). IF YOU DO NOT AGREE, DO NOT USE THE SERVICES.
Effective Date: 7 July 2025

1. BASIC TERMS AND DEFINITIONS
Term
Definition




“Services”
All features made available through the Playly Telegram App, website and affiliated software tools, including but not limited to Coins, Cases, Virtual Items, referral programmes, Robux Purchases and customer support.
“User”
Any natural person who accesses or uses the Services.
“Coins”
In‑app, non‑redeemable virtual points issued by Playly. Coins have no monetary value and cannot be purchased or withdrawn.
“Case” / “Cases”
A mechanic that allows Users to spend Coins for a random virtual item.
“Virtual Item(s)”
Digital game items that can be exported to Roblox accounts or sold back to Playly for Coins.
“Robux Purchase”
A real‑money transaction to deliver Roblox virtual currency (Robux) directly to the User’s Roblox account.
“Offer Acceptance”
Full and unconditional acceptance of this Agreement by accessing or continuing to use the Services.
“Website”
https://www.playly.gg and any subdomains.


2. MAIN PROVISIONS
2.1 This Agreement governs the legal relationship between Playly and the User regarding the use of the Services.
2.2 Capabilities of the Services include without limitation:
Browsing information about Coins, Cases, Virtual Items and Robux Purchases;
Placing Robux Purchase orders via integrated payment systems;
Earning, spending and managing Coins;
Inviting friends via referral links;
Receiving technical and customer support via Telegram or email.
2.3 Playly guarantees that Virtual Items obtained via Cases function as described at the moment of delivery. Further use of Virtual Items within Roblox is at the User’s own risk.
2.4 Detailed instructions for purchasing, exporting or selling Virtual Items, as well as Robux Purchases, are published within the bot and on the Website.

3. SUBJECT‑MATTER OF THE AGREEMENT
3.1 Playly grants the User a free, non‑exclusive, non‑transferable, revocable licence to use the Services for their intended purpose.
3.2 The licence is valid for as long as the Services remain accessible to the User.
3.3  User Restrictions: The User shall not:
Circumvent technical limitations of the Services;
Reverse engineer, decompile or disassemble any Playly software except as permitted by law;
Copy the Website or bot design or create derivative works without permission;
Modify or interfere with the functionality or performance of the Services;
Allow third parties to access the User’s Playly account;
Engage in fraud, spoofing or use third‑party software that manipulates in‑game transactions;
Use stolen or unauthorised payment methods, IDs or documents.

4. PERSONAL DATA
4.1 By using the Services, the User consents to Playly processing Personal Data in accordance with the Playly Privacy Policy.
4.2 Processing includes collection, storage, use, transfer (including cross‑border) and deletion of Personal Data necessary to operate and improve the Services or comply with legal obligations.

5. DISPUTE RESOLUTION & CLAIMS
5.1 If you have a dispute or complaint, you must submit it using the Google Form available in the "Profile" section of the app.
5.2 We will review the submitted claim at our sole discretion and in our own time. There is no guaranteed response time.
5.3 Submitting a complaint via any other channel (e.g., email, bot chat) may result in it being ignored.

6. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
6.1 Playly is not liable for losses arising from unauthorised access to a User account.
6.2 Service interruptions due to software/hardware failures or force‑majeure events release Playly from liability.
6.3 The Services are provided “AS IS” without warranties. Playly does not guarantee uninterrupted, error‑free operation or fitness for a particular purpose.
6.4 Playly may, without prior notice, at its sole discretion:
Refuse or suspend transactions;
Remove Virtual Items from inventory;
Reset Coin balances;
Blacklist payment methods;
Block User accounts.
6.4.1 The User may appeal such actions by contacting support.

7. REFUNDS
7.1 Unused Robux Purchase balances may be refunded upon request if Coins or Virtual Items were not spent/exported.
7.2 Once Coins are spent on Cases or Robux is delivered, all sales are final and non‑refundable, except as required by law.
7.3 Refund requests may be submitted at any time and may require proof of payment.

8. FINANCIAL OPERATIONS
8.1 The User must use valid, authorised payment methods that belong to them.
8.2 Withdrawal of unused real‑money balances (if ever enabled) may require identity verification and is only possible 10 days after deposit.
8.3 Subscription fees (if any) are non‑refundable once the billing period has begun. You may cancel renewal at any time; service continues until the end of the paid period.

9. CHANGES TO THIS AGREEMENT
9.1 Playly may unilaterally amend this Agreement at any time without prior notice by posting an updated version at https://playly.app/terms or within the bot.
9.2 Continued use of the Services after changes take effect constitutes acceptance of the revised Agreement. If you do not agree, discontinue use immediately.

10. NEWSLETTERS & COMMUNICATIONS
10.1 By registering, the User consents to receive service announcements and promotional emails or messages.
10.2 Users may opt out of marketing communications at any time via the unsubscribe link or bot settings; service‑related notices are mandatory.
10.3 Playly does not sell or share email addresses with third parties for marketing purposes and complies with anti‑spam laws.

11. FINAL PROVISIONS
11.1 If any provision of this Agreement is held invalid, the remaining provisions remain in effect.
11.2 This Agreement, together with the Terms of Service and Privacy Policy, constitutes the entire agreement between the User and Playly.

AML.title: Privacy policy
AML.text:
This Privacy Policy (the “Policy”) explains how Playly (“we”, “our”, or “us”) collects, uses, discloses and safeguards personal data when you (“you”, “your”, or “User”) access or use the Playly Telegram application, related websites, and any other online products or services that link to this Policy (collectively, the “Services”).
By using the Services, you acknowledge that you have read and understood this Policy. If you do not agree with any part of it, you must discontinue use of the Services immediately.

1. Definitions
Term
Meaning
“Personal Data”
Any information that directly or indirectly identifies an individual.
“Processing”
Any operation performed on Personal Data (collection, recording, storage, use, disclosure, deletion, etc.).
“Cookies”
Small text files placed on a device when visiting a website.
“Services”
The Playly Telegram app, http://www.playly.gg and other affiliated domains, APIs, customer‑support channels and marketing communications.
“User”
An individual who accesses or uses the Services.


2. General Provisions
Using the Services signifies acceptance of this Policy and the Playly Terms of Service.
Playly does not control and is not responsible for third‑party services linked from the Services.
We may modify this Policy at any time without prior notice. The “Revision Date” above will reflect the latest version. Continued use after an update constitutes acceptance of the revised Policy.

3. Information We Collect
3.1 Data Provided by You
Category
Examples
Purpose
Identification
Telegram user‑ID, Telegram username, display name, avatar
Account creation, personalization, support
Contact Details
Email address (optional)
Support, marketing with consent
Roblox Details
Roblox user‑name / UID (optional)
Export of Virtual Items, Robux deliveries
Feedback
Messages, support tickets
Service improvement

3.2 Data Collected Automatically
Usage Data — bot commands, button taps, feature interactions, timestamps.
Device & Log Data — IP address, browser/OS (website), language, referral source.
Cookies & Similar Tech (web‑only) — session cookies, analytics cookies, preference cookies.
3.3 Payment Data
Real‑money Robux purchases are processed by authorised payment processors (e.g., Stripe, UnitPay). We receive transaction IDs and status but never store full card details.

4. Legal Bases for Processing (EEA/UK)
We process Personal Data on one or more of the following bases:
Contract – to provide the Services under the Terms of Service;
Legitimate Interest – to secure, maintain and improve the Services;
Consent – for optional marketing or analytics cookies;
Legal Obligation – to comply with applicable laws (e.g., AML/KYC, taxation).

5. How We Use Personal Data
Provide, operate and maintain the Services;
Manage referrals, Coins, Cases and Virtual Items;
Deliver Robux to linked Roblox accounts;
Respond to inquiries and provide customer support;
Monitor for fraud, abuse and security incidents;
Conduct analytics and improve product features;
Send service‑related notifications (e.g., transaction confirmations);
(With consent) deliver marketing communications.

6. Disclosure of Personal Data
We share Personal Data only as necessary:
Recipient
Purpose
Payment processors
Complete Robux purchases and handle chargebacks
Roblox Corporation
Credit Robux, transfer Virtual Items
Cloud hosting & analytics providers
Service hosting, diagnostics, analytics
Advertising partners (opt‑in)
Display targeted ads
Competent authorities
Comply with law, legal process, or enforce our rights


7. International Transfers
Playly operates globally. Where Personal Data is transferred outside your jurisdiction, we rely on appropriate safeguards such as Standard Contractual Clauses or equivalent.

8. Data Retention
We retain Personal Data for as long as necessary to fulfil the purposes outlined in this Policy, comply with legal obligations, resolve disputes and enforce agreements. Telegram chat history may be retained until you request deletion.

9. Security
We implement technical and organisational measures to protect Personal Data, including encryption at rest and in transit, role‑based access controls, and regular security audits. No method of transmission is 100% secure; we cannot guarantee absolute security.

10. Your Rights
Depending on your location, you may have the right to:
Access the Personal Data we hold about you;
Request correction or deletion of your data;
Object to or restrict Processing;
Withdraw consent at any time (without affecting prior Processing);
Receive a copy of your data in portable format.
To exercise any of these rights, contact us. We may need to verify your identity before fulfilling the request.

11. U.S. State Privacy Rights (e.g., California, Colorado)
Right to Know / Access – Information about categories and specific pieces of Personal Data collected.
Right to Delete – Request deletion of Personal Data we collected from you.
Right to Correct – Rectify inaccurate Personal Data.
Right to Opt‑Out – of sale, sharing, profiling and targeted advertising. Playly does not sell Personal Data. You may opt out of targeted advertising via cookie settings.
Right to Appeal – Appeal a refusal to act on a privacy request.
We honour the Global Privacy Control (GPC) signal for browser‑based opt‑out requests.

12. Cookies & Similar Technologies
Strictly Necessary Cookies – Essential for website operation (cannot be disabled).
Analytics Cookies – Help us understand usage (e.g., Google Analytics). Set only with consent where required.
Functionality Cookies – Remember preferences like language.
Advertising Cookies – Serve personalised ads; disabled by default in the EU/UK unless consent is given.
You may manage cookies in your browser settings. Disabling cookies may affect website functionality.

13. Children’s Privacy
The Services are not directed to children under 13. We do not knowingly collect Personal Data from children under 13. If you believe we have collected such data, contact us to delete it.

14. Third‑Party Links & Integrations
Our Services may contain links to third‑party sites or services. We are not responsible for their privacy practices. We encourage you to review their policies.

15. Changes to This Policy
We may update this Policy at any time without prior notice. Material changes will be highlighted for 30 days via a banner or bot message where feasible. The revised Policy is effective immediately upon posting.
